para: This chapter explains the geometric objects which are used in &lib;.

warning.para: &lib; uses the Java Topology Suite (JTS) library for all of its geometric representation. Note also, that all access is done directly into JTS classes rather than working through an abstract layer of interfaces. The &lib; project intends eventually to switch to use an internal geometric representation and to develop and use a standard set of GeoAPI interfaces.

sect1.title: Resources
sect1.para: Geometries and their analysis in computation systems present particular issues and challenges. The scientific field of Computational Geometry has emerged to tackle many of these isssues. Some of the most important issues are presented elsewhere in this manual: see section .

sect2.title: Documentation
sect2.para:
JTS has its own suite of documentation, scattered in several places. The
older web site has documentation, see especially the 'Discussion' section. The
current web site where the current coordination occurs includes a
mailing list. JTS releases are hosted on the
sourceforge site.

The JTS Javadocs also contain useful information, although, through version 1.7.1, these are fairly thin except for:
Package com.vividsolutions.jts.algorithm#Description (scroll down)
Package com.vividsolutions.jts.overlay#Description
Package com.vividsolutions.jts.relate#Description
Class com.vividsolutions.jts.Geometry

JTS also has useful documentation in the zip distribution itself, in the 'doc/' directory. This includes:
The JTS Developer Guide
The JTS Technical Specification
which are valuable resources to understand the issue of computational precision in the JTS library.
